title: Venezuelans stage global protests, seek recognition of election victory
content: In Venezuela and cities around the world, protesters carried vote tally receipts collected by the opposition showing that their candidate won more votes.
summary: In Venezuela and cities around the world, protesters carried vote tally receipts collected by the opposition showing that their candidate won more votes.

title: Gaza faces public health crisis with first confirmed case of polio
content: The United Nations is now pushing for a pause in the fighting so it can coordinate two mass vaccination campaigns for more than 640,000 children.
summary: The United Nations is now pushing for a pause in the fighting so it can coordinate two mass vaccination campaigns for more than 640,000 children.

title: X closes operations in Brazil, blames judge’s ‘censorship’ orders
content: The social media platform and owner Elon Musk have been feuding with Brazilian Justice Alexandre de Moraes for months.
summary: The social media platform and owner Elon Musk have been feuding with Brazilian Justice Alexandre de Moraes for months.

title: Why Indonesia moved its capital to a jungle hundreds of miles away
content: The new city, Nusantara, comes as Jakarta continues to sink at a record pace.
summary: The new city, Nusantara, comes as Jakarta continues to sink at a record pace.

title: Israeli strikes in Gaza and Lebanon kill at least 25, officials say
content: Saturday’s bloodshed came after the United States and its allies expressed optimism over cease-fire negotiations to end the war in Gaza.
summary: Saturday’s bloodshed came after the United States and its allies expressed optimism over cease-fire negotiations to end the war in Gaza.

title: Jared Kushner wants to turn a wild stretch of Albania into a luxury resort
content: Kushner’s use of foreign funds is again coming under scrutiny. Environmentalists fear his planned resort could destroy a delicate ecosystem.
summary: Kushner’s use of foreign funds is again coming under scrutiny. Environmentalists fear his planned resort could destroy a delicate ecosystem.

title: What to know about Indian protests over a student doctor’s rape and killing
content: Indian doctors have called a 24-hour strike following the rape and killing of a female trainee doctor in Kolkata and protests have swept major cities this week.
summary: Indian doctors have called a 24-hour strike following the rape and killing of a female trainee doctor in Kolkata and protests have swept major cities this week.

title: What Kamala Harris did – and didn’t do – on immigration and the border
content: Vice President Kamala Harris worked with three Central American countries to improve living conditions and lower the odds that migrants would leave.
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris worked with three Central American countries to improve living conditions and lower the odds that migrants would leave.

title: Inflation has come for one of Japan’s most beloved cheap eats: Ramen
content: Japanese ramen joints are going out of business at a record pace as restaurants struggle with rising prices of ingredients, electricity and wages.
summary: Japanese ramen joints are going out of business at a record pace as restaurants struggle with rising prices of ingredients, electricity and wages.

title: Ukraine’s offensive derails secret efforts for partial cease-fire with Russia, officials say
content: The warring countries were set to hold indirect talks in Qatar on an agreement to halt strikes on energy and power infrastructure, according to officials.
summary: The warring countries were set to hold indirect talks in Qatar on an agreement to halt strikes on energy and power infrastructure, according to officials.

title: U.S. proposes new Gaza cease-fire plan, seeking agreement by next week
content: The United States, Qatar and Egypt said in a joint statement that a new cease-fire proposal was on the table, but they did not include any specifics on the deal.
summary: The United States, Qatar and Egypt said in a joint statement that a new cease-fire proposal was on the table, but they did not include any specifics on the deal.

title: In a Ukrainian prison, cells are full of young Russian conscripts
content: The capture of so many young men in the Ukrainian incursion poses a significant challenge for the Kremlin.
summary: The capture of so many young men in the Ukrainian incursion poses a significant challenge for the Kremlin.

title: Illegal border crossings fell in July to lowest level in four years
content: Border agents tallied 56,408 illegal crossings in July, a 32 percent decline from June and the fifth straight month that the figure has fallen, data shows.
summary: Border agents tallied 56,408 illegal crossings in July, a 32 percent decline from June and the fifth straight month that the figure has fallen, data shows.

title: West Bank village mourns resident killed in settler attack
content: The attack late Thursday in Jit in the northern West Bank was the latest in a string of assaults by settlers on Palestinian communities.
summary: The attack late Thursday in Jit in the northern West Bank was the latest in a string of assaults by settlers on Palestinian communities.

title: Why Thailand’s new prime minister, its youngest ever, adds to old divides
content: Paetongtarn Shinawatra is just 37, but she is part of a long-running political dynasty.
summary: Paetongtarn Shinawatra is just 37, but she is part of a long-running political dynasty.

title: Viral Olympic B-girl Raygun says the ‘hate’ has been ‘devastating’
content: Australian Rachael Gunn’s breaking performance sparked a backlash, including an online petition that Olympic officials condemned as “misleading and bullying.”
summary: Australian Rachael Gunn’s breaking performance sparked a backlash, including an online petition that Olympic officials condemned as “misleading and bullying.”

title: The war in Gaza passes a bleak, bloody milestone
content: Health authorities in Gaza say the death toll in the territory has surpassed 40,000 people. Meanwhile, Israel has stepped up its de facto capture of Palestinian land in the West Bank.
summary: Health authorities in Gaza say the death toll in the territory has surpassed 40,000 people. Meanwhile, Israel has stepped up its de facto capture of Palestinian land in the West Bank.

title: London street cleaner wins dream vacation in a contest made just for him
content: A beloved street sweeper in South London wasn’t allowed to accept a holiday trip gifted by his town, so a special “contest” just for him was set up instead.
summary: A beloved street sweeper in South London wasn’t allowed to accept a holiday trip gifted by his town, so a special “contest” just for him was set up instead.
